data.question: What is the purpose of using flexible porous metal-organic frameworks in drug delivery?
data.answer: The purpose is for a controlled drug delivery, highlighting their unique properties for adapting their pore opening to optimize drug-matrix interactions.

data.question: What materials were used as matrices for the adsorption and in vitro drug delivery of Ibuprofen?
data.answer: Flexible nanoporous chromium or iron terephthalates (BDC) MIL-53(Cr, Fe) were used as matrices.

data.question: True or False: The amount of inserted drug depends on the metal (Cr, Fe) constitutive of the hybrid framework.
data.answer: False

data.question: What was the observed effect of the 'breathing phenomenon' on the drug adsorption properties of MIL-53 solids?
data.answer: The breathing phenomenon modulates their pore size upon adsorption of organic molecules, affecting drug adsorption properties.

data.question: True or False: The Ibuprofen content was estimated by UV−vis spectroscopy, thermogravimetric analysis (TGA), elemental analysis, and X-ray fluorescence (XRF).
data.answer: True

data.question: What was the effect of increased temperatures or repeated impregnations on the drug loading capacity of MIL-53 solids?
data.answer: Increased temperatures or repeated impregnations did not affect the drug loading capacity.

data.question: True or False: The adsorbed amount of Ibuprofen increases with the initial Ibuprofen/material ratio expressed in weight.
data.answer: True

data.question: What was the optimal value for the Ibuprofen to material weight ratio for maximal drug loading?
data.answer: The optimal value was a 3:1 Ibuprofen to material weight ratio.

data.question: True or False: The nature of the solvent, the contact time, and the Ibuprofen to porous solid relative ratio have a major influence on the amount of drug adsorbed.
data.answer: True

data.question: What was the observed kinetics of Ibuprofen delivery from MIL-53(Cr, Fe) materials?
data.answer: The delivery of Ibuprofen was very slow, complete only after 3 weeks, with a zero-order kinetics.

data.question: True or False: The structural and spectroscopic characterizations provided for the solid filled with Ibuprofen.
data.answer: True

data.question: What was the effect of the 'breathing effect' on the X-ray powder diffraction (XRPD) patterns of MIL-53 solids?
data.answer: The breathing effect drastically affects the XRPD patterns of the phases, with changes in the cell volumes and symmetry.

data.question: True or False: The aluminum and chromium MIL-53lt solids exhibit a reversible pore opening which involves atomic displacements upon dehydration.
data.answer: True

data.question: What was the observed behavior of the iron analogue MIL-53(Fe) regarding its pore opening?
data.answer: The iron analogue MIL-53(Fe) opens its pores only during the adsorption of molecules, unlike its Al and Cr counterparts.

data.question: True or False: The structural change upon dehydration−hydration cycles in Al and Cr solids can be explained by the formation of hydrogen bondings.
data.answer: True

data.question: What was the result of the adsorption of Ibuprofen in MIL-53(Cr, Fe) solids regarding the residual porosity?
data.answer: After the Ibuprofen incorporation, there were almost no residual porosity observed for the MIL-53(Cr)−Ibu system.

data.question: True or False: Similar N2 adsorption measurements were not carried out in MIL-53(Fe) materials since the dehydrated form exhibits no porosity for nitrogen at 77 K.
data.answer: True

data.question: What was the observed effect of compacting the MIL-53(Cr, Fe) materials as cylindrical pieces on the pores?
data.answer: Compacting as cylindrical pieces led to a small contraction of the pores, in agreement with the flexibility of the framework.

data.question: True or False: The delivery of Ibuprofen from MIL-53(Cr, Fe) materials was performed using a simulated body fluid (SBF) at 37 °C under continuous stirring.
data.answer: True

data.question: What was the observed difference in the first step of the delivery curves as a function of the metal nature in MIL-53 materials?
data.answer: For chromium, the delivery was close to linear, while for iron, there was a rapid beginning of delivery before a pseudo plateau and another increase of the delivery.
